channel.title: unsupervised learning on Cbyad
channel.description: Recent content in unsupervised learning on Cbyad

item.title: Machine Learning Notes
item.description: Supervised Learning Linear regression with one variable Target : From a dataset (red points), we want to find a general method to automatically get an hypothesis function ${h_\theta(x)=\theta_0+\theta_1x}$ (blue line) that fit as well our points to predict new incomming data. Solution : Find a cost function $J(\theta)$ of parameter $(\theta_0,\theta_1)$ with $\theta$ that minimise $J$ $$ J(\theta_0,\theta_1) = \dfrac{1}{2m} \sum_{i=1}^m (h_\theta(x^{(i)})-y^{(i)})^2 $$ where $m$ the number of training sets
